data.title: 530 Fifth Ave
data.text:
DIMENSIONS

The building is 327 feet high. It occupies the entire western block of Fifth Avenue, between 44th and 45th Streets. Approximately 200 feet along Fifth Avenue, 175 feet along 44th Street, and 100 feet along 45th Street.

TRANSPORTATION

Conveniently located within two (2) blocks of Grand Central Terminal and three (3) blocks from Bryant Park. Offers immediate accessibility to commuter rail, bus, city bike and metro/subway lines.

ENTRANCES AND LOBBIES

Tenants and guests enter via the main entrance on Fifth Avenue. The loading dock is located on 44th Street, approximately 150' west of Fifth Avenue. It is served by the primary freight elevator and loading dock corridor, and can accommodate two (2) trucks at a time.

HOURS OF OPERATION

Standard hours of HVAC operation are 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., Monday through Friday.

AIR CONDITIONING

The building is cooled by a central chilled water plant that includes three (3) 550-ton Carrier highpressure steam absorption chillers and one (1) 2,400-ton, 3-cell SPX Marley cooling tower−one cell of which provides 24/7/365 service.

HEATING

High-pressure steam from Con Edison is converted to low pressure steam and is distributed throughout the building to serve AHU’s, the perimeter hot water system, and radiators at the retail level.

SUPPLEMENTAL HVAC

The building is set up to service the additional needs of tenants requiring supplemental HVAC. Two (2), 200- ton Evapco cooling towers provide 24/7/365 condenser water up to the 20th floor. Alternative solutions available for floors 20 through 26.

ELECTRIC CLOSETS

Typically, there are two (2) electric closets located on floors 3-19, and one (1) on floors 20-26.

CLASS E SYSTEM

The building is equipped with a new addressable Honeywell “Class E” fire alarm system with audible alarms, elevator recall functionality and fireman’s service, hard-wired smoke detectors, strobes, exit signs, and emergency back-up lights. The central alarm system monitors smoke detectors, fire sprinkler flow, and pull stations; alerting the local fire department and a monitoring company should an alarm arise.

SPRINKLER SYSTEM

The building is 85% (higher % as of 2020) sprinklered and features a combination of a threeriser sprinkler/standpipe system, 7,500-gallon reserve tank, two (2) fire pumps, and three (3) exterior combination sprinkler/standpipe Siamese connections. Standpipe hose racks are located on each floor of Stairways A, B, C, and D; as well as in the lobby slop sink closet.
